title: Feed and rations for backgrounding Nov 2020

tasks.task: Conducting a feed ration consultation for backgrounded cattle.
subtasks: Identifying the seasonal timing for placing new calf crops on feed.
Evaluating the impact of birth months (January, April, June) on calf size and marketability.
Analyzing historical trends in feed prices (corn, distillers grains, hay, wheat mids) over recent years (2017-2020).
Discussing the role of co-product feeds (distillers grains, wheat middlings, soybean meal, etc.) in cattle rations.
Assessing balancing nutrients (crude protein, total digestible nutrients) in cattle feed.
Considering feed costs per pound of gain and their relation to energy versus protein costs.
Addressing feed management issues such as bunker silage moisture, moldy dry beans, and feed testing.
Presenting various feed ration examples with different hay types, grains, and supplements (e.g., limestone, canola meal, wheat middlings) to achieve specific rates of gain.
Evaluating the effect of rate of gain on feed costs and cattle performance.
Discussing the importance of bedding, water, and health management (e.g., antibiotics, vaccinations, coccidiostats) in maintaining cattle health.
Recommending the use of feed additives (e.g., anophores, implants) to improve feed efficiency and gain.

tasks.task: Feeding backgrounded cattle during fall 2020 while considering feed costs, protein needs, and market timing.**
MAINTASK: Conduct a feed ration consultation for fall 2020 backgrounded cattle.
subtasks: Compare average weights and growth rates of different age groups.
Identify cost trends and their implications for current feeding strategies.
Determine availability and cost-effectiveness of local feed sources.
Use real-world data and calculations to define necessary nutrient levels.
Compare costs of different rations (e.g., hay + wheat middlings vs. hay + distillers grains).
Develop a step-up feeding schedule for new rations.
Recommend strategies for maintaining cattle health and optimal feed consumption.
Address potential health issues (e.g., coccidiosis, acidosis) and their prevention.
